content.description: A tricky jam section down low leads into the groove which leads to the roof and a airy left traverse.
content.location: This route is about 50 feet to the left and around the corner from Alternate Lives.  It faces west and can be accessed from the "Trail of Tears".

content.description: A lower section of funky stone leads up to the crack and face above.
content.protection: Trad gear.  Walk off to east.
content.location: This route is located approx. 50 feet right of Rock Monster.  An attractive crack up a steep section of stone.

content.description: A good chimney and crack for the grade.
content.protection: Trad gear - small to medium.  Rappel from the small slung tree/clump at the top, or scramble down climber's left.
content.location: This route is about 30 feet left of The Edge of Night.  It is the nice chimney in black rock which turns into a crack in light rock.

climbs.name: Rock Monster
climbs.fa: D. Rider,  S. Fielder,  D. Zuniga   12/18/09

content.description: This route tackles the thin roof that leads up to good jams and to the wide crack.  Fun to the top.
content.protection: Trad gear. Walk off to east.
content.location: This route is located on the east side of South Peak (the first of the three little peaks, it will be on your left side as you face uphill.)It is a prominent crack in brown stone that widens and leans to the right.

content.description: This climbs the diagonal seam that starts 30 feet left of The Young and Restless and it joins that route at the top. A fun little outing with good protection... unless you're reckless and don't rope up.
content.protection: 1ea: small - medium nuts; cams up to #2 Camalot

content.description:
About 40 feet down and around the corner from The Young and Restless lies this very short but attractive splitter: the Orange Crack. 

  Climb a right-facing corner to a ledge and walk a few feet right, below a steep, off-finger crack. Enjoy two body-lengths of Indian Creek (with footholds!) then top out left and then up. 

  Scramble down climber's right or walk off climber's left.
A short line good for practicing gear placement.
content.protection: Trad gear. Wires and small cams.  Scramble to the top, then head climber's left for descent options.
content.location: The right leaning crack that divides light rock from black rock.  Just left of The Young and Restless.

content.description: A fun corner to a little roof and now you're craggin!  There is loose rock below the roof that should be tossed.
content.protection: Trad gear. Some big stuff for the roof.
content.location: This route is located approx. 50 feet to the left and around the corner from Rock Monster at the base of South Peak.  A nice corner system to a small overhang.  Walk off to east.

content.description: Weave up the black patena on the face left of Tongue Mud.  As delightful a 5.4 face climb as there is.  Scramble down climber's left or rappel from slung small tree/clump at the top.
content.protection: cams & nuts, mostly in horizontals and mostly tiny & small
content.location: the black face left of Tongue Mud

content.description: A cool crack variation to the Days of Our Lives corner.
content.protection: Trad gear.  Walk off to east.
content.location: This is the crack to the left of the Days of Our Lives corner. A variation that leads up to the same roof.

content.description: up the crack/corner system left of the face left of Tongue Mud; nicer and better protected than it looks; no mandatory OW/chimney moves if you choose...
content.location: the wide crack/corner system left of Tongue Mud

content.description: This south facing drainage gets plenty of sunshine with some afternoon shade.  A few hikers may wander thru, but no crowds.
